Summary Heading: What you normally expect from Renaissance...
Summary: The Good: Hotel is as good as other Renaissance hotels. Assures me that my Renaissance choices are always meeting my expectations. Hotel is located far from the LA noise in friendly neighborhood near Orange County John Wayne Airport. Very close to Newport Beach. I really liked the live performance in the lobby at nights. Small fireplace outdoor makes you feel cosy and warm in breezy Christmas nights. Like most Renaissance hotels, the random modern objects in the lobby are wisely selected and arranged which bring an artistic character to the hotel. In close neighborhood, you can go to South Coast Plaza for shopping and there are plenty of good food options nearby.  The Bad: Parking can be a problem. Hotel has a self parking garage for a fee but not a proper guest parking. All the

We also love that our warm atmosphere impressed you along with our beautiful decor and artwork. The live entertainment and outdoor fires are a few of my favorite features too and I am glad you could enjoy them too. However, we regret you endured any oversights while at our property. We take your input seriously and will resolve these matters immediately. We hope you will be back at Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel so that we can win you over completely.

Summary Heading: TERRIBLE HOTEL. STAY AWAY. THEY STEAL YOUR MONEY.
Summary: I stayed at the Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel from December 23 to December 26. We reserved this on December 16th and paid it in full. When I arrived on the 23 I was told it was not paid. After stating that it had been and the front desk telling me it wasn't, I decided to just pay for one night and figure it out tomorrow. They charged around $220. The next morning I called the front desk to confirm it had been paid. I spoke with Stacy, who said that it had been paid and they would refund the money immediately, which they never did. The next morning my sister bought something from the hotel store which was $32.33. When I woke up the $32.33 charge was made on MY card. The reasoning for the hotel was that we "had the same last name."   So, if someone goes to your hotel and has the
Manager Response: We thank you for your time and feedback. We did look into this matter immediately and were informed that the manager did request the night to be compensated through Expedia. It has been confirmed that the amount was refunded. This was explained at check-out and the final bill shows $0. We are sorry there was any confusion. This is not typical and unfortunately, as the reservation was not made with us, we cannot make the changes ourselves without approval from the third party. We will ensure our team explains this clearly in the future.

Summary: Arturo, Raz, and Reggie were fantastic. The bar was fantastic, particularly the bar staff, and the hotel was great. The remodel looks excellent, this is definitely a five-star experience. All of the guests at the bar seemed very happy with their stay.
Manager Response: Alex, we cannot thank you enough for such kind feedback! It was exciting to read how impressed you were with our team's charm and dedication, especially Arturo, Raz, and Reggie! Our goal is to provide a perfect stay for all of our valued guests here at Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel. Your perfect score and praise are heartwarming, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: Stayed here for one night and wish I'd stayed somewhere else. The car park is not exactly at the hotel's door, especially if you park on the Upper Level. When we checked in, they were one of the only hotels on our honeymoon not to wish us congratulations. The room was on the ground floor, noisy and not particularly special, though it was quite large.  In addition, nobody went above and beyond to assist with bags though we had loads, ask us if it was a special occasion or wish us well for our trip. The most friendly and considerate member of staff we came across was the housekeeping lady who was super polite and warm. I would not recommend staying here.
Manager Response: Congratulations, Sarah, and my deepest apologies for our team not saying this sooner! Knowing we marred such a special trip is disheartening. We will be using your feedback as a teachable moment with our staff so we can ensure the high level of service our valued guests deserve. Please allow us another opportunity to improve your impression and show you what we are truly capable of.

Summary: Found myself having to be in the O.C. all weekend so decided to stay the night. The Renaissance Newport Beach fit the bill! From getting out of my car (valet staff) to checking in to hotel staff milling about the property, all have been friendly and helpful. The property is modern and fun, with a restaurant and bar (I really wanted to try a pumpkin martini but didn’t have the time). I have the basic king room which looks exactly as it does on the website. The use of floor with an area rug makes the room feel larger and more open. There is a Keurig in the room with coffee and tea and they have room service as well (waiting for my oatmeal and coffee as I type this) and a smart TV with access to your streaming accounts. Needed a late checkout which was no problem.   Frances from
Manager Response: Reading that our beautifully modern ambiance impressed you upon arrival is exciting, Dana. However, we are even happier to know that our accommodations, amenities, and service met all of your expectations here at Renaissance Newport Beach! Thank you for your glowing compliments and recommendation! We hope to have you back in the future!

Summary: This hotel is very convenient to the airport. They have a free shuttle to and from the airport. The elevators are crazy fast which is so nice!  The best thing about this hotel is the breakfast. You have to get it! Everything on the menu is delicious! We would definitely stay here again! Rooms are nice too.
Manager Response: The fresh local flavors used by the talented chefs at CURRENT Coastal Cuisine are my favorite too! I am so happy you could indulge during your stay! It was a treat being able to offer a seamless stay with our ideal location, comfortable accommodations, and delicious dining options here at Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel. We hope we can do it again soon!

Summary: I stayed for a week for business and pleasure at this beautifully renovated hotel. The staff and managers are outstanding. They truly care about their guests and passionate about service. Special mention for excellent service by Mary (Restaurant Manager), Reggie (waiter) and Markus ( GM). The Wednesday reception for BonVoy Elite provided an extra touch and the food were amazing. It is also worth mentioning the cleanliness and convenience to everything. I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Here at Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel, we understand that excellence is in the details! We are so happy our small moments and personal service made your experience five-star worthy. We will gladly celebrate our team for a job well done, especially, Mary, Reggie, and Markus! Thank you for recommending us so highly. We hope we get the chance to welcome you again soon!

Summary: Wow! The RNB has been our family destination for years.  We love this hotel with its warm and loving staff and fun Beachy decor.  Thank you to Mackenzie and Braydon at the front desk for taking great care of us from check in to check out. Breakfast at Current is always awesome.  The food is so delicious and always has a beautiful presentation.   While we have our favorites from the menu, they also brought back the awesome buffet.  There is a great assortment for all and one item Is better than the next thanks to a great Chef!  Luis is unbelievable. He takes such great care of us. He makes the best specialty coffee for us with Vanilla lattes being  a family favorite. The breakfast staff works so hard and takes customer service to a whole new level. Carina, Luis and Mary are like

All of us will be eagerly awaiting your next trip so you can further indulge in our fantastic features and luxurious accommodations!

Summary: Such an amazing stay at Renaissance Newport Beach. This hotel has such an amazing vibe. The entire place is so nice and clean, the decor was very hip and modern. Every single person who works here was so friendly and eager to help.   We stayed in a 2 Queen room that had a Mountain View. The room was spacious, clean and very well kept. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone visiting.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I saw the reviews on this hotel a day before checking in so I couldn’t cancel our reservation anymore. Day of our checkin, I thought it weird that they charged incidentals on my credit card 5x for a night stay but I let it go since the charges were pending. Overall, our 1 night stay was good. The hotel has a nice modern touch and it was clean. The bed was comfy. Checkout was fast and lady at the counter said that they would email me the bill. They never did, I had to call again to ask. A few hours later I was billed for another 4x my actual bill. Tried talking to a manager, was hung up on TWICE.  I don’t know what kind of company you guys are running but these are FRAUDULENT CHARGES and someone has to be accountable for it. DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL if you don’t want to deal with

Summary: Spent a Saturday night in town and was originally reluctant to stay here, as I recall it originally being the Marriott Newport Beach, an average business hotel stay. The hotel has been through a major renovation with a new look. Very modern lobby, bar and rooms. The hotel restaurant food is average at best, however there are hundreds of places nearby, especially if you are a "foodie".  The rooms are ample size, and if you like a soft bed, this is the place. Personally I prefer a medium or firm mattress. The room service menu mirrors the downstair lobby bar. Basic food at good prices.  After our event, we went to the pool area which was very disappointing. Again you will be reminded that this is a business persons hotel.  One of the smallest pools that appeared to be a

Thank you for letting us know how much you enjoyed our fresh, welcoming new look and spacious, well-appointed accommodations. Summary: Don’t book with this hotel ! They charged my card for nights I never got confirmation for . Website is always freezing . I’ve been waiting weeks for a refund on my card. Accounting manager told me I could wait up to 2 months for my refund. Then told me I’m better off making a claim with my banks. So unprofessional please stay away from this hotel.

Summary Heading: Newport Beach Hotel - Another nice stay
Summary: Recently spent three nights at the Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel.   This was my second stay at this hotel, and I intend to stay again here on my next trip to the area.   Initially, my room was spacious and clean as was the hotel.  This hotel is about 5 minutes from John Wayne Airport ( an airport shuttle services is provided at no charge t/from SNA) and about 45 minutes (off peak) to LAX.  Although this hotel is not located on or within walking distance to a beach, it is centrally located near Huntington Beach, Newport Beach Pier, and Angel Stadium.   Each trip via Uber is a short 15 - 20 minute ride /  $15 - 20 Uber/Lyft charge.   The hotel pool is relaxing and the fitness center is well equipped for a good workout.  The hotel also features a nice bar and convenient
Manager Response: We can't think of a more wonderful description of the welcoming hospitality we strive to offer, and your review has certainly brightened our day! Summary Heading: Good location, nice property, lacking customer service
Summary: Located near John Wayne airport, you’ll be minutes away from everything Orange County has to offer.  The public spaces and rooms seem to have been recently renovated.  Everything is pretty bright and modern.  Our room was very comfortable and I slept great on the bed and, minus a very ugly stain on the couch, it was spotlessly clean.  Self-parking is a whopping $37/day.  We had breakfast in the restaurant each day and it was very good.  However, the restaurant hours posted throughout the property were incorrect and they should be updated.  However, the customer service I encountered left a lot to be desired. We booked a package on Marriott.com that included parking and a daily dining credit and yet at check-in they had no record of the package details.  I showed them our booking
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us, as it's helpful to see how we are meeting your needs and how we can improve. We can't help but feel disappointed by your comments regarding our service as providing warm hospitality is how we are known. We will review your feedback internally and hope to have a second chance to win you over completely.

Summary: Stayed at this hotel for a business trip. We held an on-site meeting for 11 people.   This is a well-maintained property located close to John Wayne Airport. Strongly suggest taking Uber from Airport to hotel. It's not really walkable.  The room was above average and showed a lot of wear. The door key reader was malfunctioning and without asking, they provided a credit.  The bed was fabulous and the linens very upscale.  The hotel restaurant serves breakfast only and it is not included in the room rate. There are several great restaurants within walking distance.   The meeting room was spacious and comfortable. The hotel catered fruit, pastries,  coffee and tea for breakfast. The food was a little light for 11 people. Our meeting room was off the pool and we enjoyed taking our
Manager Response: Leanne, we appreciate you taking a few moments to share your thoughts about your recent stay at the Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel! It's wonderful to hear that you enjoyed our comfortable accommodations and beautiful event space. Reviews like yours help other travelers find us and experience relaxing, memorable getaways. Thank you for your terrific feedback and we hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for my kids’ soccer tournament. It’s beautifully decorated with lots of room to work in the lower lobby. It’s across from the John Wayne Airport and located between two of the best malls in the area. The staff were very friendly and welcoming and the restaurant served some delicious breakfast items. Make sure to ask for Jaime. She is the best!!   There is a great gym with a purified water machine and lots of machines. There is also a nice pool. The hot tub was being repaired.   We had a wonderful junior suite on the corner with a large patio.   Self and valet parking are expensive as are most hotels these days. There is a charger so we were able to charge our Tesla for free with miles every morning. That was really convenient.   No Starbucks or coffee bar
Manager Response: Gina, we're so glad that our beautiful property, terrific location, excellent service, and terrific amenities scored us a perfect score! Thank you for choosing the Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel for your recent stay. We look forward to celebrating your fantastic comments with the rest of the team and we hope you'll return soon for another five-star visit to the Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for my birthday weekend. It is a great central location for a base to explore Orange County. All staff was very friendly and helpful.  We had a couple minor hiccups but Ivan Gonzalez took care of us at the front. The complimentary shuttle in they’re black SUV was very nice. Breakfast at the restaurant was very good.  We will stay here again when we are in the area.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for choosing the Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel for your special birthday celebration! We're elated that our terrific setting, helpful amenities, delicious dining, and excellent staff surpassed your expectations. It will be our pleasure to welcome you back anytime for another five-star getaway!

Summary Heading: Went to relax and got robbed
Summary: Stayed at hotel for holiday  weekend to relax and get away with husband.  I travel a lot for business and stay/stayed at Marriotts a lot.  First day toilet was not working and no hot water. Got fixed so okay. Next day left for the day to spend with family and when we got back we had been robbed! 98% of our things in the room were taken, from Dirty clothes, shoes, to makeup case, foot spray chargers and personal items, mail. Luckily meds were left for us- thanks. No kidding … wiped out.  Had to fly back in same clothes i slept in. 2 days later snd hotel says they will contact us. We called police. On-site hotel security said no cameras on our floor (high floor) snd no security during daytime hours onsite,  nice to know you and your things are safe, whether it’s true or security
Manager Response: To read comments like yours is not the experience we expect to deliver to our guests.   We take all matters of theft seriously and truly apologize for this. Thank you for sharing your concerns.

Summary Heading: Be certain you read the fine print
Summary: I chose this hotel because of the room type that was available. Multiple photos on the app show a balcony. The room does not have a balcony and the general manager told me a balcony is  not in the room description  and the photos are wrong. He offered no adjustment.  My advice is call ahead and ask for the specific detail, or choose another hotel.  I don’t throw my stats around often but as a lifetime titanium elite- this is not acceptable from Marriott- to have information on the web that is misleading and known to be incorrect.   Pics are from the app that clearly show and mention the balcony.

Summary: I travel frequently on business and this is my favorite hotel in the area.  Beautifully decorated.  Staff is top notch.  Food is excellent for all meals. I see there was no one there, so I said, I don't believe you, and then just like that, they just had a cancellation and a suite available. Front desk agents were three women but could not seem to get the check-in process done correctly amongst all of them. The room was not clean to Marriott standards, with no water; when you call the front desk, it takes someone 5-7 minutes to answer. Summary: Recently spent three nights at the Renaissance Newport Beach.  I enjoyed my stay and have no hesitation recommending this hotel to solo travelers, couples, families, and all others.  This hotel is about a 5 minute drive from John Wayne airport, and about 15  minutes to Newport Beach via Uber/Lift where the average fee is between $15-20.  I found all hotel staff to be professional, courteous, and helpful.  The hotel was very clean and my room ( deluxe suite) was very comfortable.  The pool area looked inviting and was well kept.  The gym wad also well appointed with free weights, upper/lower body machines, treadmills, elipticals, and statiinary bikes.  Finally, my experience at the hotel bar was also excellent. Great stay.

Summary Heading: Fresh, Super clean, High style, Luxurious

I also found the hallways quiet and peaceful. They also have a restaurant and bar that is perfect for a quick retreat with great cocktails on your way to/from the room. This is a great hotel for friends or get-away couples. Both parking and internet are additional costs, but the price is still super reasonable for a spotless, clean and luxurious stay. Check it out!

It's also very hard to get anyone on the phone if you are calling ahead. Finally, $35 for a self parking spot in a largely deserted part of town is scalping.

Manager Response: Dear Been2Bagan, We appreciate your recent stay and four review. Your wedding group brought so much joy to our hotel and the entire team enjoyed serving your group. We will look into the Cabana situation and fix that. Yours in hospitality, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: Our experience at the Renaissance Newport Beach hotel is by far our best ever.  The valet service was especially impressive not only because of their level of professionalism but also because of their efficiency, attentiveness and competence coupled with a great attitude.  Luis, Gian, David with the valet service and Yurina at the front desk all showed great care in the level of service they provided us.  We highly recommend anyone to stay at the Renaissance Newport Beach hotel if they want to experience the highest level of customer service and comfort.
Manager Response: Dear oldaivette1, We appreciate your recent stay and five star review. The greatest compliment  you can give a hotel is to recommend it to others and we appreciate your highly recommend. I will personally thank Luis, Gian, David and Yurina for their service to you on your most recent stay. Yours in hospitality, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: Very helpful staff (except for a surly bartender)....waiter went the extra mile to seat us in a more quiet area.  Loud music is pervasive but apparently enjoyed by the young guests. Decor is minimalist and recently refurbished,   Bed is very comfortable....nice shower .... bath sink configuration is sleek and modern but does not drain properly.  Coffee machine had only Decaf option and tea. Parking fees are steep and you are not allowed to self-park although there is plenty of space on the grounds.  We will not return; much preferred the Fairmont.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We are glad you enjoyed your room and the service from our staff.  While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that helps us improve. I apologize for your negative experience.  We thank you for your stay.

Summary: So, all I wanted for a quick getaway was to go to Newport Beach so my hubby booked here after finding a pretty good deal.  We had a GREAT day, spending maybe 5 minutes in hotel room until we got back to room tonight and are ready for bed.  After washing up we decided to sleep in different beds since all they had was 2 doubles (which I think is BS anyways)... I lay down and feel something wet on my leg and am startled because our wet swimsuits are in his car & we haven’t even been in room for 20 minutes and hadn’t sat on “my” bed...I pull back the covers and see what looks like a pee spot. Here’s the thing- it was under the top covers so tell me the housekeeper didn’t see that?? Or were sheets even changed?? Never in any hotel I’ve ever stayed in have I had this happen... So my
Manager Response: Dear Heather D, WE appreciate your recent stay and review. Unfathomable is the only way to describe my reaction when I read your review. We never want any guest to leave with such a negative response and feeling at our hotel. Let me assure you as a Marriott brand hotel this is not how w e run our hotels and we have standards and policies in place to make sure all rooms are inspected after cleaning. I have shared you response with our team at our morning standard and they are embarrassed that any guest could leave our hotel with such a feeling. We hope you give us an opportunity in the future to show you a true Renaissance Newport Beach experience. Yours in hospitality, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel many times for over 20 years for business. Over the course of that time there have been several management changes and I have always been happy with the hotel. I expected to be completely satisfied when I saw that Marriott was going to operate it as a Renaissance. However my stay at the Renaissance was more than disappointing. After a long day of meetings and travel I arrived after 8PM and was given a room on the 10th floor. The room smelled very strongly of fresh paint so I tried to call the front desk to tell them about the smell. The phone in the room did not work. When you try to call Marriott on your cell the number gets you to corporate Marriott. Nowhere near the front desk of the Newport Beach Renaissance. I had to dress to go down to the front
Manager Response: Dear Pat H, We appreciate your recent stay and review. Pat your loyalty is wonderful to our property and thank you for it. I am disappointed that you have tried one of our fine competitors in our market but understand that you last stay was not great. We are finishing our renovation now and will be complete in the next three weeks. We are refining the hotel now and your eloquent response will help us be better. Yours in hospitality, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: Nice hotel, stayed there for years when it was the Fairmont. Pool service is good and nice area to relax when there's not kid's running all over. Be ready for the fees! The room charge was a good price, but when we were paying for it, there was a $38 service fee with tax, then a $35 resort tax plus $30 per night for parking, geez!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I believe the hotel completed a recent renovation. The decor was straight out of a magazine. The hotel was beautiful. Very clean lobby, halls and rooms. Definitely had a beachy vibe. The staff were very nice and accommodating. The location was perfect. Walking distance to some eateries. Very close to major highways and of course, only minutes to the beach. We will definitely be staying here on our next visit to Newport Beach.
Manager Response: Dear Amanda H, We appreciate your recent stay and five star review. As a father of daughters, I appreciate how precious time away with them can be. Delighted that we assisted you have a great experience and that you both enjoyed our beach vibe. We will use your comments about décor straight out of a magazine and share your review with the team. Yours in appreciation, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary Heading: The only thing this hotel has going for it is its location
Summary: I am so disappointed with my experience here. I stayed here over the weekend for my best friend's 30th birthday. For starters, their phones are a joke. It took me 3 days to get ahold of anyone so I could add my friend's name to the room so she could check in for us on her birthday. I finally got ahold of someone the night before - thank goodness, but it wasn't until I figured out some way to get around their terrible phone system. Your only option for parking here is $33 a day valet. Self parking or anything cheaper than $33 a day would nice since this isn't a Ritz or JW or something. My friend arrived before me on Friday and went to the pool. Her sister and her shared a wrap by the pool and both had food poisoning the rest of the weekend from it. There was no A/C on in the
Manager Response: Dear Molly M, We at the Renaissance Newport Beach appreciate your recent stay and review. Thank you for being a Marriott Elite member and I apologize that we did not live up to our brand promise on your recent stay. 30th Birthday celebrations are once in a lifetime events and our role was to make it for your best friend a memorable experience. Rude service and phone issues as well as housekeeping challenges are all items that I have shared with the team and will make this a teachable moment. We serve many meals daily and have had no food borne illnesses challenges but apologize that your sister was feeling unwell. Thank you for your comments about comfortable beds, great location and nice valet team, we will grow on these and make our hotel better. Yours in hospitality, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: My family and I traveled to Newport Beach CA stayed at the Renaissance Hotel Newport Beach August 2-5 2018 I booked on line prior the hotel appeared to nice & good perks. Everything at this hotel is a fee! Their is NO self parking available & only Valet parking, It was not until check out are you advised the only option of valet parking cost you $33.00 a day. When I booked on line the perk of breakfast when traveling as a family is a big deal, the buffet is NOT free or included it is actually $25.00 a person! Family traveling with children laundry is a big deal, the Renaissance has NO laundry facilities on site.
Manager Response: Dear Mechelle L, We appreciate your recent stay and review of the Renaissance Newport Beach. You are correct about the valet only at our property, we have it listed on all websites but apologize if you did not see it. We have some packages that include breakfast and parking and that me be a better option in the future. The hotel is completing a full renovation and we will be adding laundry facilities for our guests in the future. We hope you can join us again in the future and see the value of staying in our hotel. Your in hospitality, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: I have been in this hotel during her glorious time it was a Meridien, went las winter and just few days ago after remodeling. Maybe people will say this is a nice one, for me this is a miss as a choice in decoration and finish. Cheap floor looks like too much like vinyl bathroom sink is also cheap material and even the faucet is not holding properly on the sink, I predict the furniture will not survive too long. They did not even replace everything from the time it was a Marriott, so you have miss match in the room specially in the bathroom. When you are in the room you want to get out of it, so it is the perfect hotel for hard working people they come and go very fast. Now let’s talk about the restaurant it is low average. And the décor of the lobby is cheap one with no harmony
Manager Response: Dear lolotte, We appreciate your continued loyalty to our hotel since it was a Meridien 23 years ago. As a loyal returning guest I do apologize that our new transformation into the Renaissance Newport Beach is not to your liking. Design is so personal and our modern look has been received overwhelmingly positive but understand that it may not be for everyone. As a Platinum Member I am more disappointed that we failed in your service expectation. We currently have not received back renovated suites but I want to let you know that we will have 54 fully new suites available at the end of August and would make sure that our Platinum guests are the first to discover them. As a hotelier for life it pains me that you did not feel welcome in my hotel and I never want a guest to feel that way. Please give us an opportunity in the future to have a true Renaissance experience. At your service, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary Heading: Not Quite Ready For Prime Time
Summary: As a Marriott platinum member, I have an expectation when I check into an upper tier Marriott property.  This hotel has potential, but is not meet the Renaissance standard yet.  I checked in early and was given a room that was not fully furnished and the air conditioning was not working (at all).  I went back to the desk and was given a new room.  The room is fine, but the AC can’t keep up on a warm day.  The ice machine on the 5th floor was broken, so have to go to another floor.    There is no concierge lounge (yet), which I don’t recall being mentioned at reservation or on the web.  They compensate with breakfast coupons.  Parking is a whopping $33/day, be prepared.    While the stay had challenges, the property is nice and new and should evolve into a first class hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Tim H, We appreciate your recent stay and review. As our refresh is rapidly coming to an end in August, I want to assure you we will be ready for prime time soon. As a Marriott Rewards Platinum member you are vital to the future success of our hotel and want you to know we will get better every day and become the first class hotel you deserve in our area. Yours in hospitality, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: This hotel is across the street from John Wayne Airport and is large and modern with a nautical theme.  The rooms are large and the bathroom is excellent with a lighted makeup mirror.  A second chair in the room would have been nice and there was lots of room for it.  The windows open so we could enjoy the wonderful breeze.  The workout room is slamm but adequate.  The front desk staff sis very helpful, giving us maps and restaurant recommendations.  Parking is $33 per day and is valet only, which is a little inconvenience, but the service was very good.  The location is in the business area, but it’s a short drive to the beach, South Coast Plaza, or the freeways.
Manager Response: Dear psbauer135, We at the Renaissance Newport Beach appreciate your recent stay and review. Delighted that you enjoy our design elements and our great area beyond the beach. You made by team talking about our great staff, our ambassadors are what makes coming to work here so great everyday and thank you for recognizing them. At your service, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: I have visited this hotel a couple times, it’s formerly the Duke hotel, a new remodel of the grounds and rooms is bringing good change to this place, it might go to weekend get away, The suites in this hotel are especially nice, very spacious with all the amenities you could’ve won in a four-star hotel, pool and spa are very nice and always improving, if you are looking for a quick orange county beach getaway, this is a good spot to do it.
Manager Response: Dear Matt B,  It is always a pleasure to respond to a 5 star review and thank you for it. As we complete our refresh and make our culture come alive we will need many returns. We hope we have earned yours. At your service, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: I stayed one night before a local event, and I couldn’t have been more pleased with my stay.  They greeted me with a refreshing drink, which is unusual for a 4 star Hotel. The lobby space is open and engaging.  My room was big for a 4 Star Hotel. It had nice accessories and all that you would want. It was very hot that weekend, but the air conditioning was super good.  The bell service was very good. They also have a shuttle that will take you anywhere within 5 miles which was useful for those trips that were too close for Uber. And it was right on time.  I ordered room service for breakfast, and the food was very good. They gave me a time that it would be delivered, and they beat the time. The staff was courteous as was all the staff during my stay.  Check out was quick and
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a true hidden gem and only moments from the John Wayne/Santa Ana/Orange Airport (depending on what you call the airport..😁).  It is currently under renovations but the loud noises stop at night.  The hotel and rooms are superb! Photos never do justice.  It is going to be amazing when they are done.  I was in one of the newly renovated rooms on the seventh floor.  Room service is great and still served traditional style on a tray (I love) and not in a to go container (do not love).  The only item I would recommend that they make sure to upgrade is the gym.  They need more treadmills but otherwise the gym is nice and overlooks the pool on the third floor.  The flooring is the best part!  No more dark carpet.  Yippee!!! I will be back!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed the new rooms and that you had a great in room dining experience.  We in fact are continuing to upgrade our property and the gym is next.  We do hear your comments and sincerely appreciate them.  . We hope to welcome you back in the near future!

Summary Heading: First stay and will be the last
Summary: I guess I should have already knew when I initially call to confirm my reservation at this hotel that my stay will go not as plan. I called to confirm my reservation, and the front desk agent was nothing but RUDE and COLD. When Yurina picked up the phone she was not only cold but condescending from the moment she opened her mouth. It made me felt like I was interrupting her time and that she was having a bad day. Here's the other part- After checking in, my room's trash bin still have trash in it from the previous stay. I called the front desk and their response was "Oh, let me send up housekeeping, was there anything else I may do for you" I was shocked.  There was no APOLOGY. I was shocked from the respond I got after reporting that there was trash left from prior guest. I
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel and providing your honest feedback.. Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. We are sorry about the unsatisfactory service you received from the staff.  As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel teams to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place.   With regards to billing, feel free to reach out to me directly at the hotel main number and I can personally follow up.  Additional details not included in this review are required.  Once again, our sincerest apologies. Thank you again for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Newport Beach.

Summary: I spent 4 nights here in one of the newly renovated rooms on the 7th floor (be sure to ask for a renovated room).  Jenny at the front desk made checking in easy.  There is a frig in the room to keep your water cool, and the A/C works well, but is a bit noisy if the unit is on auto.  (If your room is on the west side, be sure to close the black-out curtains to keep the hot sun out of the room, and also lower the room temperature a couple of degrees when you go out for dinner, so it will be coming down to your sleeping temperature while you are gone.)  One of the nice improvements they made that I appreciated is a lighted filigree around the mirror in the bathroom that serves as a nightlight, so you don't have to leave the bathroom lights all on.  The bed is comfortable, and so
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review. We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay in our great location and that Jenny made your arrival a smooth one. We appreciate your feedback regarding your dining experience as well and have shared it with the Culinary team.   We hope to welcome you back and be your hotel of choice for the future!

Summary: We got an updated room that was very nice and comfortable. Convenient location to the SNA airport. Lobby smelled very nice. Very clean and staff was very friendly. Got a great AAA price for such a nice hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The whole staff was great and friendly. The room was remodeled, clean and the bed comfortable.  The only drawback was there are no dressers in the rooms to put your cloths. Like camping you live out of your suitcase.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice Remodel Downstairs But Rooms Are Lacking!
Summary: I stay at this location at least twice per year but this is my first visit since the property recently rebranded and remodeled. The new look is fantastic and I was assigned one of the updated rooms on the 4th floor.  First thing that was obvious is that the beds were lower...which is great. I always felt like a high jumper trying to get into bed! The non-desk chair was not as comfortable as before, but was OK.  The new rooms leave much to be desired for the business traveler. The desk space is not conducive for in room work as there are few power outlets available around the desk. Suggestion is to put a table in the open space next to the desk to hold the coffee pot and ice bucket, and free up the   desk top! Add lamps that have additional power plugs. Also, the TV is stationary
Manager Response: Dear Joe A, We at the Renaissance Newport Beach appreciate your recent stay and review. You review is astute observer of hotel rooms and I compliment you on the items you noticed in our room. Our design team had some of the same comments and I forwarded them your response. We are adding a pedestal for the safe in order to move it into the closet, that in turn will allow us to move the Keurig machine off the desk. We are also adding a table next to the chair in the room and that will clear the ice bucket and glasses off the desk and give our guests more work space and we have added three more electrical outlets by the side of the TV. We are always looking to improve and appreciate your great feedback. Yours in hospitality,  Brian Keys General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, great location, but a little overpriced
Summary: I stayed here for work for two nights in May 2018.  I flew in early to Orange County airport, the hotel has a shuttle every 30min to the airport which was very convenient as it is only a 5min drive. The shuttle driver was very friendly and helpful in getting luggage in and out of the van. The hotel has very friendly front desk staff, bell boys, and waiters. I has allowed to check in early and I was very grateful as it gave me some time to relax before the conference started. Free wifi is a plus.   The room was very comfortable, very clean, a classic look, nothing very fancy, but with an elegant touch. I would say that this compared relatively to a Hilton or a Marriott, and not the more modern Westin chain. The room was ample in size, large TV, small fridge, a working desk, and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were visiting from Canada and were going to drive up the coast the next day so only spent one night here. I can't say much for location but the service while we were there was excellent. The additional $33 for parking is a little over the top and it's mandatory valet but we did know this prior to booking as we read some reviews. We had to ask to be put in one of the renovated rooms which I thought was unnecessary. I would probably stay here again if I ever came back to visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just wanted everyone to know about the $33/night parking fee because I didn't see it anywhere in the website I purchased my 2 nights from about this fee. $66 is ridiculous for  parking that is right in front of the hotel that can be totally self-serviced. Extended Stay America Hotel is right next door without the parking fee and I so regretted reserving Renaissance because it really made us mad.
Manager Response: Dear Supermoon1,  We appreciate your recent stay and review. Our property has been valet only for many years based on the businesses around us owning the spaces at the front of the hotel. We try to make sure that all guests know of our valet parking situation but apologize that it was not clear to you. I never want a guest of mine to leave so disappointed in their stay and hope you can see past this issue and give us another opportunity to serve in the future.  Yours in hospitality, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: We stayed 5 nights & had a lot of family & friend events. It was a very comfortable, not fancy & relaxed stay with very personable & friendly staff. Decor is quite good, imaginative, inviting & fun. Food is good, pool service also good. It’s not too spendy, but the forced valet parking fee of $33/day was not plainly stated on Expedia so was a surprise. Mandatory valet seems to be the norm in OC, which does make sense. In fairness, they valets are very efficient & nice. However, I think it should be included in room price, so one is prepared. Overall, we were pleased & will consider returning if occasion arises.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Prepare yourself to be nickel and dimed.....
Summary: This place is OK but we left feeling ripped off. We weren't especially impressed with the half completed hotel renovations but I guess I could overlook that. Very comfortable beds, carpet that desperately needed replacing, and stains on the marble top desk, but the room was clean. The hotel is situated in the middle of an industrial area with very little within walking distance. What is simply unforgivable is charging 33$ per night for parking when there is ample parking all around the hotel that could easily be opened up for self-parking. This is just such as clear scam it just made us feel ripped off. That and our breakfast cost close to 50$ each morning. Sad they feel the need to rip of guests in this way. Definitely won't be returning.
Manager Response: Dear StephanieOTR, We appreciate your recent stay and review on this website.  We appreciate your 5 star review for service but apologize that you felt nickel and dimed. As you mentioned there is some parking outside the hotel that is controlled by the local businesses and we do not have access to. Hope you can see past the parking fee and join us again for a service experience. Yours in hospitality, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Stay. Good Location. Would Stay here again.
Summary: They are doing renovations on this property, so it is not 100% yet, however I can see what they are trying to do. Staff is excellent, very nice, bar area and bartender good. Located right across the street from John Wayne Airport. About 20 minutes from Disney taking the highway, and 35 minutes taking the streets with light traffic. About 10 minutes away from Fashion Island and 20 minutes away from beaches.   This is a Valet only hotel, 33/day, so be prepared for that. Great valet service everyone efficient and pleasant.   My room was kind of dated, the beds and carpet were a little older, the bed was squeaky but comfortable. Again they are renovating, so I would not knock them for that. This looks like it was a recent acquisition by Marriott, so I know it will be up to par soon.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I like the Renaissance Newport quite well. They offered points or breakfast in the hotel for being a Marriott Gold member. The room was nice and clean. The bed was comfortable.  The only think I really hated was being caught off guard by the mandatory $33  a night valet parking.  There is no other option unless you arrive without a car.  This made for an excellent rate not so excellent.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice hotel. Free shuttle from airport. $33 a day parking fee. Unfortunately this parking fee is typical for many of the hotels in the area. Staff is very nice. But operator does not always pick up. Rate we got was very good except for parking fee add on. Lacstion is not good for food access unless you have a car.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: It's been renovated... into a day spa. If you want a hotel, stay elsewhere.
Summary: There is no question that this hotel needed a facelift. When Marriott/Renaissance bought it, there was hope that they'd put the money into it to make it a nice place to stay.  It is in a convenient location but the renovation they're doing has burned through a boatload of money, but unfortunately converted their rooms into "modern" enclaves including a bed, bathroom and virtually no other useful amenities you'd associate with a luxury hotel.    As someone who travels for a living, and usually in a location for 2-5 nights at a time, I unpack. Even if I were staying only one night, I'll unpack most of my suitcase so I can hang my suit, press my shirts, have my toiletries, etc.    But Marriott, in many of their renovations (Marriott Michigan Ave in Chicago, Renaissance Denver
Manager Response: Dear Semmy831, We appreciate you recent stay and review on this website. It is rare that I receive such a detailed review with photos with comments so I appreciate you taking the time to give me such a detailed and eloquently written review. Delighted that you receive one of renovated rooms and disappointed that the design elements are not to your preference. The overwhelming response has been positive but design preference is personal. We are waiting on an additional work table for our rooms, unfortunately the table can in tarnished so we are replacing them. Yours in hospitality, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: This property is currently under renovation and does not have a concierge lounge or spa. Our room was recently renovated (similar to the new lobby look). Staff was also professional and courteous. Not sure how much rates will increase once the renovation is complete but this property is currently a great deal for Newport Beach.
Manager Response: Dear GreatTraveltime, We appreciate your recent stay and review. Our Spa should be back online in July and I hope you will have the opportunity to enjoy it in the future. Delighted that you had a good stay and you found our stay professional and courteous. At your service, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: We had to switch rooms three times due to black mold in our bathroom sinks. Maid staff either isn’t properly trained, or simply don’t care. We had to somewhat complain to get the two night exorbitant valet fee waived. Make sure to get a room in the newly renovated towers if you stay there.
Manager Response: Dear B-Taw, Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. My name is Brian Keys and I am the General Manager at the Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel. As you mentioned in your review we are under a complete refresh of the hotel to finish before the summer. I apologize if you had mold in your room and know we are not in the habit of knowingly putting our guests in room with any issue. That you had issues in multiple rooms you received during your recent stay did not meet our expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  The experience you described is not characteristic of the level our hotel and the service our associates strive to provide.   At your service,  Brian Keys General Manager

Summary Heading: New face lift left some scares.
Summary: Shared room with a gentleman that is Platinum Marriott card member. He requested upgraded suite because I was joining him. We got a one bedroom suite with sofa bed. The sofa bed was terrible.So I asked for a pillow top cover to improve the comfort. It took three days and four housekeeping help to get it right.Done of which spoke any English. The bright spot was the food, in the dining room and catered meals for an event I was attending. The rooms were clean but accessories left a lot to be desired, especially for an upgraded room. Could only imagine what regular rooms were like.
Manager Response: Dear Arsen, We appreciate your recent stay and review on this four star review on this website.  Delighted to read that you had a great dining experiences in our hotels.  We are coming to the end of our extensive renovations but have not any new suites completed so I apologize that you found the sofa bed uncomfortable. It is my hope you have an opportunity in the future to experience the new suites and live the sweet life in SoCal. Yours in hospitality, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: Renaissance remodel a huge miss.  Lobby lounge and restaurant looked better before the renovation.  The colors, rope, rattan, and wicker furniture do not depict the Orange County lifestyle.   Not 4 Stars.
Manager Response: Dear sherrirjaff, We appreciate your recent stay and review on this website. I was so disappointed that you do not appreciate our new design. The overwhelming response has been positive but understand that that design tastes are very personal. There are many great traditional styled hotels in our community and we wanted to be unique. Yours in hospitality, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary Heading: Was once good and may be again - but there is something wrong right now
Summary: I am a business traveler and spend 80+ nights at hotels each year. I am pretty reasonable with my expectations I think - I know a perfect service experience is hard to come by. I also recognize this hotel is undergoing a rebranding and was being renovated during my last three stays. That said - each of the three times I got a distinct impression of sloppiness in how this property is being run. Last time I stayed, my key card did not work at the room even after I made the trip downstairs with all my bags to get it recoded (I tried calling on the internal phone from the floor several times but no one answered). The renovated room was ok but looked like it was still missing some furniture - there was an empty space where a sofa or an armchair was supposed to be. Another thing that
Manager Response: Dear Dan B, We appreciate your recent stay and review.  As a road warrior who obviously know hotels well, I apologize that we failed you. We do value our customers feedback and sorry if yours feel through the cracks. I hope to have the opportunity in the future to show you the true Renaissance Newport Beach and tr redeem myself in your opinion. At your service, Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: The location is great and the staff was incredible.  I had breakfast here while staying at the Duke. It was a buffet, but it was a very good buffet. I'm still thinking about the granola... I went back for seconds... okay, thirds... it was that damn good.  Fruit, meats, potatoes, and eggs were all well above standard buffet fare. Especially the potatoes... nice and crispy! The waitstaff was very attentive and kept my drink full. I would definitely go back for another round... especially the granola.  Pro Tip: If I remember correctly, my breakfast was comp'd because of my Marriott Platinum status (as they have no member lounge yet). The Duke is apparently fairly new to the Marriott family. Remember to ask for that.
Manager Response: Dear Bil M, We appreciate your recent stay and five star review.  You are so right the granola is to die for, I too find myself going back for more and has asked our Chef Jessica for the recipe many times.  Delighted that our waitstaff, were on it and that you enjoyed our Newport Beach lifestyle. Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: Hotel staff was top notch! Everyone we encountered was pleasant and helpful. The restaurant food and service was excellent. You must try the mac n' cheese, it is fantastic! My son even brought along his Xbox One, typical teenager, in his own words,"The Wi-Fi was flawless; no time lag at all!" :)  Exceptional stay! We will definitely return.
Manager Response: Dear -mcpeterson2, We appreciate your recent stay and five star review on this website.  As a father of teens who love their XBOX, I understand the importance of great Wi-Fi and most importantly easy connection.  Come back and experience our Newport Beach Lifestyle soon.  Brian Keys General Manager

Summary: I picked this hotel due to proximity to JWA.  It is situated right down the street.  It took about 20 minutes total to get from the hotel, return car and get through TSA (with PreCheck).  The room was typical but comfortable.  Views were fine.  the TV worked, and the bed was comfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I came to the Renaissance Newport Beach Hotel for a business conference and was really impressed with the facilities.  The hotel is really nice with good meeting rooms as well as hotel rooms.  The bar/restaurant area has tons of seating and there are outdoor options as well.  The room temperature control was great and the bed comfortable to sleep in.  The elevated pool area was very nice, although it's not open as late as I would like, but that's probably an effort to keep the noise level down for the guests in the nearby rooms. Summary: This was the Duke when I stayed there early in Feb but it was being remodeled. I was pretty excited to stay here but the whole hotel was under remodel so I didn’t get to experience it fully— I did eat at the restaurant and I enjoyed my experience and it was Valentine’s Day so I had the special, steak and shrimp. Food, including dessert, was presented nicely, but the steak was over cooked. Service was good at the hotel and the room was nice— but the air ran all night but didn’t seem to be cooling. I would stay again based on the location to the airport and would be curious to see the remodel.
